meanings.definition: To mark or cross out with an X.
meanings.sent1: She xed out the incorrect answer on her test.
meanings.sent2: He always xes out his mistakes with a red pen.
meanings.sent3: The teacher xed out the wrong spelling on the whiteboard.
meanings.sent4: The detective xed out the suspect's name from the list.
meanings.sent5: The artist xed out the unnecessary details in the sketch.

meanings.definition: To fix or secure in place.
meanings.sent1: He xed the loose screw to prevent it from falling.
meanings.sent2: She xes the picture frame to the wall carefully.
meanings.sent3: The handyman xed the broken chair with strong glue.
meanings.sent4: The gardener xed the fence to keep the rabbits out.
meanings.sent5: The engineer xed the leaky pipe with a new sealant.

meanings.sent1: They xed the subscription after deciding not to renew.
meanings.sent2: The company xes the contract if the terms are not met.
meanings.sent3: The student xed the plans for the weekend due to bad weather.
meanings.sent4: The airline xed the flight due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent5: The manager xed the meeting to free up everyone's schedule.
